title: SPS Study Quality Assessment Record
description: Schema generated from SPS_quality_dictionary.csv for constraining structured extraction outputs (e.g., LangExtract). Fields are optional unless listed in 'required'.

ID.description: Section: Study Details | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr, Case Control, Case Series & Reports, Controlled Intervention Studies, Data Extraction, Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Guidance: Study ID

extractor.description: Section: Study Details / Use this tab for case reports, case series, or studies that report individual patients characteristics instead of grouped data. | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr, Case Control, Case Report Form, Case Series & Reports, Controlled Intervention Studies, Data Extraction, Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Guidance: Initials of extractor

first_author.description: Section: STUDY DETAILS / Study Details | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr, Case Control, Case Series & Reports, Controlled Intervention Studies, Data Extraction, Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Guidance: First author's last name

pub_year.description: Section: STUDY DETAILS / Study Details | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr, Case Control, Case Series & Reports, Controlled Intervention Studies, Data Extraction, Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Guidance: Publication Year (multiple variants)

objective_stated.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr, Case Control, Case Series & Reports, Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Criterion: Was the study question or objective clearly stated? (multiple variants) | Guidance: 1. Was the study question or objective clearly stated? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable (multiple variants)

criteria_stated.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr, Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Criterion: Were eligibility/selection criteria for the study population prespecified and clearly described? | Guidance: 2. Were eligibility/selection criteria for the study population prespecified and clearly described? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

participation_50.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Criterion: Was the participation rate of eligible persons at least 50%? | Guidance: 3. Was the participation rate of eligible persons at least 50%? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

same_population.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Criterion: 1. Were all the subjects selected or recruited from the same or similar populations (including the same time period)? | Guidance: 4.1. Were all the subjects selected or recruited from the same or similar populations (including the same time period)? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

criteria_specified.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Criterion: 2. Were inclusion and exclusion criteria for being in the study prespecified and applied uniformly to all participants? | Guidance: 4.2. Were inclusion and exclusion criteria for being in the study prespecified and applied uniformly to all participants? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

samplesize_estimate.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Criterion: Was a sample size justification, power description, or variance and effect estimates provided? | Guidance: 5. Was a sample size justification, power description, or variance and effect estimates provided? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

exposures_measured_prior.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Criterion: For the analyses in this paper, were the exposure(s) of interest measured prior to the outcome(s) being measured? | Guidance: 6. For the analyses in this paper, were the exposure(s) of interest measured prior to the outcome(s) being measured? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

timeframe_sufficient.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Criterion: Was the timeframe sufficient so that one could reasonably expect to see an association between exposure and outcome if it existed? | Guidance: 7. Was the timeframe sufficient so that one could reasonably expect to see an association between exposure and outcome if it existed? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

exposure_levels.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Criterion: For exposures that can vary in amount or level, did the study examine different levels of the exposure as related to the outcome (e.g., categories of exposure, or exposure measured as continuous variable)? | Guidance: 8. For exposures that can vary in amount or level, did the study examine different levels of the exposure as related to the outcome (e.g., categories of exposure, or exposure measured as continuous variable)? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

exposure_measures_defined.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Criterion: Were the exposure measures (independent variables) clearly defined, valid, reliable, and implemented consistently across all study participants? | Guidance: 9. Were the exposure measures (independent variables) clearly defined, valid, reliable, and implemented consistently across all study participants? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

exposure_multiple_assessment.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Criterion: Was the exposure(s) assessed more than once over time? | Guidance: 10. Was the exposure(s) assessed more than once over time? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

outcome_defined.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr, Case Series & Reports, Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Criterion: Were the outcome measures (dependent variables) clearly defined, valid, reliable, and implemented consistently across all study participants? (multiple variants) | Guidance: 11. Were the outcome measures (dependent variables) clearly defined, valid, reliable, and implemented consistently across all study participants? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable (multiple variants)

blinded.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr, Case Control, Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Criterion: Were the outcome assessors blinded to the exposure status of participants? (multiple variants) | Guidance: 12. Were the outcome assessors blinded to the exposure status of participants? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable (multiple variants)

LTFU_20.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Criterion: Was loss to follow-up after baseline 20% or less? | Guidance: 13. Was loss to follow-up after baseline 20% or less? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

confounders_adjusted.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Criterion: Were key potential confounding variables measured and adjusted statistically for their impact on the relationship between exposure(s) and outcome(s)? | Guidance: 14. Were key potential confounding variables measured and adjusted statistically for their impact on the relationship between exposure(s) and outcome(s)? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

quality_assessment.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr, Case Control, Case Series & Reports, Controlled Intervention Studies, Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Guidance: Quality assessment: select one of the following: - poor - fair - good

notes.description: Section: 8.section: comments / Notes | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr, Case Control, Case Report Form, Case Series & Reports, Controlled Intervention Studies, Observ Cohort & Cross sect | Guidance: Notes/Comments (if POOR, state why) (multiple variants)

population_defined.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Control | Criterion: Was the study population clearly specified and defined? | Guidance: 2. Was the study population clearly specified and defined? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

sample_size_justification.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Control | Criterion: Did the authors include a sample size justification? | Guidance: 3. Did the authors include a sample size justification? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

controls_same_population.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Control | Criterion: Were controls selected or recruited from the same or similar population that gave rise to the cases (including the same timeframe)? | Guidance: 4. Were controls selected or recruited from the same or similar population that gave rise to the cases (including the same timeframe)? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

consistent_criteria.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Control | Criterion: Were the definitions, inclusion and exclusion criteria, algorithms or processes used to identify or select cases and controls valid, reliable, and implemented consistently across all study participants? | Guidance: 5. Were the definitions, inclusion and exclusion criteria, algorithms or processes used to identify or select cases and controls valid, reliable, and implemented consistently across all study participants? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

cases_clearly_defined.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Control | Criterion: Were the cases clearly defined and differentiated from controls? | Guidance: 6. Were the cases clearly defined and differentiated from controls? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

random_selection.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Control | Criterion: If less than 100 percent of eligible cases and/or controls were selected for the study, were the cases and/or controls randomly selected from those eligible? | Guidance: 7. If less than 100 percent of eligible cases and/or controls were selected for the study, were the cases and/or controls randomly selected from those eligible? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

concurrent_controls.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Control | Criterion: Was there use of concurrent controls? | Guidance: 8. Was there use of concurrent controls? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

exposure_occurred_prior.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Control | Criterion: Were the investigators able to confirm that the exposure/risk occurred prior to the development of the condition or event that defined a participant as a case? | Guidance: 9. Were the investigators able to confirm that the exposure/risk occurred prior to the development of the condition or event that defined a participant as a case? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

clear_measures_exposure.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Control | Criterion: Were the measures of exposure/risk clearly defined, valid, reliable, and implemented consistently (including the same time period) across all study participants? | Guidance: 10. Were the measures of exposure/risk clearly defined, valid, reliable, and implemented consistently (including the same time period) across all study participants? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

confounders_measured.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Control | Criterion: 1. Were key potential confounding variables measured and adjusted statistically in the analyses? | Guidance: 12.1. Were key potential confounding variables measured and adjusted statistically in the analyses? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

matching_analysis.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Control | Criterion: 2. If matching was used, did the investigators account for matching during study analysis? | Guidance: 12.2. If matching was used, did the investigators account for matching during study analysis? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

population_described.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Series & Reports | Criterion: Was the study population clearly and fully described, including a case definition? | Guidance: 2. Was the study population clearly and fully described, including a case definition? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

cases_consecutive.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Series & Reports | Criterion: Were the cases consecutive? | Guidance: 3. Were the cases consecutive? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

subjects_comparable.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Series & Reports | Criterion: Were the subjects comparable? | Guidance: 4. Were the subjects comparable? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

intervention_described.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Series & Reports | Criterion: Was the intervention clearly described? | Guidance: 5. Was the intervention clearly described? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

adequate_FU.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Series & Reports | Criterion: Was the length of follow-up adequate? | Guidance: 7. Was the length of follow-up adequate? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

stats_welldescribed.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Series & Reports | Criterion: Were the statistical methods well-described? | Guidance: 8. Were the statistical methods well-described? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

results_welldescribed.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Case Series & Reports | Criterion: Were the results well-described? | Guidance: 9. Were the results well-described? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

representative.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr | Criterion: Were the participants in the study representative of those who would be eligible for the test/service/intervention in the general or clinical population of interest? | Guidance: 3. Were the participants in the study representative of those who would be eligible for the test/service/intervention in the general or clinical population of interest? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

all_enrolled.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr | Criterion: Were all eligible participants that met the prespecified entry criteria enrolled? | Guidance: 4. Were all eligible participants that met the prespecified entry criteria enrolled? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

size_adequate.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr | Criterion: Was the sample size sufficiently large to provide confidence in the findings? | Guidance: 5. Was the sample size sufficiently large to provide confidence in the findings? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

clearly_described.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr | Criterion: Was the test/service/intervention clearly described and delivered consistently across the study population? | Guidance: 6. Was the test/service/intervention clearly described and delivered consistently across the study population? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

loss_to_FU.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr | Criterion: 1. Was the loss to follow-up after baseline 20% or less? | Guidance: 9.1. Was the loss to follow-up after baseline 20% or less? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

LTFU_accounted.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr | Criterion: 2. Were those lost to follow-up accounted for in the analysis? | Guidance: 9.2. Were those lost to follow-up accounted for in the analysis? 0 = no 1 = yes (including studies with NO loss to follow-up) NA = not available / not applicable

stats_for_change.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr | Criterion: 1. Did the statistical methods examine changes in outcome measures from before to after the intervention? | Guidance: 10.1. Did the statistical methods examine changes in outcome measures from before to after the intervention? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

pvalues_provided.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr | Criterion: 2. Were statistical tests done that provided p-values for the pre-to-post changes? | Guidance: 10.2. Were statistical tests done that provided p-values for the pre-to-post changes? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

interrupted_timeseries.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr | Criterion: Were outcome measures of interest taken multiple times before the intervention and multiple times after the intervention (i.e., did they use an interrupted time-series design)? | Guidance: 11. Were outcome measures of interest taken multiple times before the intervention and multiple times after the intervention (i.e., did they use an interrupted time-series design)? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

group_effects.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Before-After (Pre-Post) N contr | Criterion: If the intervention was conducted at a group level (e.g., a whole hospital, a community, etc.) did the statistical analysis take into account the use of individual-level data to determine effects at the group level? | Guidance: 12. If the intervention was conducted at a group level (e.g., a whole hospital, a community, etc.) did the statistical analysis take into account the use of individual-level data to determine effects at the group level? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

randomised.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Controlled Intervention Studies | Criterion: Was the study described as randomized, a randomized trial, a randomized clinical trial, or an RCT? | Guidance: 1. Was the study described as randomized, a randomized trial, a randomized clinical trial, or an RCT? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

adequate_randomisation.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Controlled Intervention Studies | Criterion: Was the method of randomization adequate (i.e., use of randomly generated assignment)? | Guidance: 2. Was the method of randomization adequate (i.e., use of randomly generated assignment)? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

treatment_allocation_concealed.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Controlled Intervention Studies | Criterion: Was the treatment allocation concealed (so that assignments could not be predicted)? | Guidance: 3. Was the treatment allocation concealed (so that assignments could not be predicted)? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

participants_blinded.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Controlled Intervention Studies | Criterion: Were study participants and providers blinded to treatment group assignment? | Guidance: 4. Were study participants and providers blinded to treatment group assignment? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

assessors_blinded.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Controlled Intervention Studies | Criterion: Were the people assessing the outcomes blinded to the participants' group assignments? | Guidance: 5. Were the people assessing the outcomes blinded to the participants' group assignments? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

similar_baseline.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Controlled Intervention Studies | Criterion: Were the groups similar at baseline on important characteristics that could affect outcomes (e.g., demographics, risk factors, co-morbid conditions)? | Guidance: 6. Were the groups similar at baseline on important characteristics that could affect outcomes (e.g., demographics, risk factors, co-morbid conditions)? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

dropout_20.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Controlled Intervention Studies | Criterion: Was the overall drop-out rate from the study at endpoint 20% or lower of the number allocated to treatment? | Guidance: 7. Was the overall drop-out rate from the study at endpoint 20% or lower of the number allocated to treatment? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

diff_dropout_15.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Controlled Intervention Studies | Criterion: Was the differential drop-out rate (between treatment groups) at endpoint 15 percentage points or lower? | Guidance: 8. Was the differential drop-out rate (between treatment groups) at endpoint 15 percentage points or lower? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

intervention_high_adherence.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Controlled Intervention Studies | Criterion: Was there high adherence to the intervention protocols for each treatment group? | Guidance: 9. Was there high adherence to the intervention protocols for each treatment group? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

other_interventions_avoided.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Controlled Intervention Studies | Criterion: Were other interventions avoided or similar in the groups (e.g., similar background treatments)? | Guidance: 10. Were other interventions avoided or similar in the groups (e.g., similar background treatments)? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

realiable_measures.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Controlled Intervention Studies | Criterion: Were outcomes assessed using valid and reliable measures, implemented consistently across all study participants? | Guidance: 11. Were outcomes assessed using valid and reliable measures, implemented consistently across all study participants? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

sufficient_sample_size.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Controlled Intervention Studies | Criterion: Did the authors report that the sample size was sufficiently large to be able to detect a difference in the main outcome between groups with at least 80% power? | Guidance: 12. Did the authors report that the sample size was sufficiently large to be able to detect a difference in the main outcome between groups with at least 80% power? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

outcomes_prespecified.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Controlled Intervention Studies | Criterion: Were outcomes reported or subgroups analyzed prespecified (i.e., identified before analyses were conducted)? | Guidance: 13. Were outcomes reported or subgroups analyzed prespecified (i.e., identified before analyses were conducted)? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

intention_to_treat.description: Section: Risk of Bias Assessment | Applies to publication types: Controlled Intervention Studies | Criterion: Were all randomized participants analyzed in the group to which they were originally assigned, i.e., did they use an intention-to-treat analysis? | Guidance: 14. Were all randomized participants analyzed in the group to which they were originally assigned, i.e., did they use an intention-to-treat analysis? 0 = no 1 = yes NA = not available / not applicable

country.description: Section: STUDY DETAILS | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Country/Countries where study was conducted

study_design.description: Section: Study Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Study Design (for case reports or small series, use the case report form)

aims.description: Section: Study Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Aims of the Study

participant_number.description: Section: Study Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Number of participants

age_central_measure.description: Section: Study Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Age - measure of central tendency. Select one of the following: - mean - median NA = not available, NA, not reported

age_central.description: Section: Study Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Age - value of central tendency (numeric)

age_variability_measure.description: Section: Population Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Age - measure of variability (listed in order of preference) SD = standard deviation (1st preference) SE = standard error (2nd) 95CI = 95% confidence interval (3rd) IQR = interquartile range range = range (5th) NA = not available, not reported (6th)

age_variability.description: Section: Population Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Age - value(s) of variability

ethnicity.description: Section: Population Characteristics / section: basic demographic data | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Ethnicity (select one) - white = White/Caucasian - africa = African/ Afro-Caribbean - E_asia = East Asia (Japan, Korea, China) - S_asia = South Asia (India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka) - SE_asia = South East Asian (everything East of India and South of China which will cover Thailand, Malaysia, Singapore) - latin = Latin American (non-African origin; central and S America, without Caribbean) - other = other (specify in next column)

ethnicity_specify.description: Section: Population Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Ethnicity (specify) If you selected "other", specify with text. Otherwise leave blank.

percent_males.description: Section: Population Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Percent Males Male patients/Total patients. List the value to two decimal places (e.g. "45.55")

included_diagnosis.description: Section: Population Characteristics / section: basic demographic data | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Diagnosis of participants included (select) - Stiff_Person - Stiff_Limb - PERM - new_category = new category if identified, specify - mixed = mixed population - other = other, specify in next column - NA = not available, NA, not reported

included_diagnosis_specify.description: Section: Population Characteristics / section: basic demographic data | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Diagnosis (specify) If you selected new_category or other, specify with text

diagnostic_criteria.description: Section: Population Characteristics / section: basic demographic data | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Criteria used to make the diagnosis Provide below the details of the criteria used to make the diagnosis - copy and paste from text if needed (no special characters) (multiple variants)

disease_severity.description: Section: Population Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Disease Severity If the study recruited patients with a specified severity - Copy and paste from manuscript the explanation of severity and how this was defined.

enum: First manifestation If study reports first symptoms of a group of participants
copy and paste below from the manuscript. If details for individual cases provided
first_manifestation.description: Section: Population Characteristics / section: basic demographic data | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: First manifestation If study reports first symptoms of a group of participants, copy and paste below from the manuscript. If details for individual cases provided, use case report form. (multiple variants)

spsd_symptom.description: Section: Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: SPSD symptoms in early disease (select) - stiffness - spasms - startle = excessive startle - multiple = multiple, specify in next col - other = other, specify in next col

spsd_symptom_multiple.description: Section: Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Additional data for previous column - if multiple symptoms reported List symptoms as text, separated with semicolons. Otherwise, leave blank.

spsd_symptom_other.description: Section: Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Additional data for previous column - if other symptoms reported List symptoms as text, separated with semicolons. Otherwise, leave blank.

stiffness_onset_distribution_multiple.description: Section: Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Stiffness at onset (multiple) If "multiple" was selected, list as text, separated by semicolons. Otherwise, leave blank.

stiffness_onset_distribution_other.description: Section: Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Stiffness at onset (other) If "other" was selected, specify with text. Otherwise, leave blank.

symptoms_established.description: Section: Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: SPSD symptoms in established disease (select single option from list) - stiffness - spasms - startle = excessive startle - anxiety - oculomotor = oculomotor disturbance - cerebellar - visual = visual symptoms (e.g. photosensitivity) - cognitive - gastrointestinal = other than abdominal wall muscle cramps) - multiple = multiple, specify in next col - other = other, specify in overnext col

symptoms_established_multiple.description: Section: Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: SPSD symptoms in established disease (multiple) If "multiple" was selected, list as text, separated by semicolons. Otherwise, leave blank.

symptoms_established_other.description: Section: Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: SPSD symptoms in established disease (other) If "other" was selected, list as text. Otherwise, leave blank.

stiffness_established_distribution.description: Section: Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Stiffness distribution in established disease (select) - lumb_prox_LE = lumbar/proximal legs - distal_LE = distal leg(s) - UE = arm(s) / upper extremity - axial = axial(thoracic,neck) - trismus - multiple = multiple, but not generalised - generalised = generalised - other = other, specify in next col

stiffness_established_distribution_multi.description: Section: Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: SPSD distribution in established disease (multiple) If "multiple" was selected, list as text, separated by semicolons. Otherwise, leave blank.

stiffness_established_distribution_other.description: Section: Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: SPSD distribution in established disease (other) If "other" was selected, list as text, separated by semicolons. Otherwise, leave blank.

established_mRS.description: Section: 4. section: established disease, signs and symptoms / Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Disability when disease fully established (SPSD symptoms established; mRS) 0 - No symptoms. 1 - No significant disability. 2 - Slight disability. 3 - Moderate disability. 4 - Moderately severe disability. 5 - Severe disability. incontinent. 6 - Dead (multiple variants)

spasms_distribution.description: Section: Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Spasms distribution - lumb_prox_LE = lumbar/proximal legs - distal_LE = distal leg(s) - UE = arm(s) / upper extremity - axial = axial(thoracic,neck) - multiple = multiple, but not generalised - generalised = generalised - other = other, specify in next col

spasms_distribution_multiple.description: Section: Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Spasms distribution (multiple) If "multiple" was selected, list as text, separated by semicolons. Otherwise, leave blank.

spasms_distribution_other.description: Section: Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Spasms distribution (other) If "other" was selected, list as text. Otherwise, leave blank.

treatment.description: Section: Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Course / symptoms potentially influenced by treatment ? (select) - none = no treatment - BZD = benzodiazepine or similar - immunotherapy - both = both symptomatic and immunotherapy - NA = not available, not reported

antibody_status.description: Section: 4. section: established disease, signs and symptoms / Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Antibody status (select) - GAD - GlyR - amphiphysin - DPPX - seronegative - multiple = multiple, specify in next col - other = other, specify in next col - not_tested = no test performed - NA = not available, not reported, unclear if tested

antibody_status_multiple.description: Section: Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Antibody status (multiple) If "multiple" was selected, list as text, separated by semicolons. Otherwise, leave blank.

antibody_status_other.description: Section: 4. section: established disease, signs and symptoms / Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Antibody status (other) If "other" was selected, list as text. Otherwise, leave blank.

antibody_titre.description: Section: 4. section: established disease, signs and symptoms / Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Antibody titre

antibody_units.description: Section: 4. section: established disease, signs and symptoms / Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Antibody units

antibody_testsystem.description: Section: 4. section: established disease, signs and symptoms / Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Antibody test system

antibody_tests.description: Section: 4. section: established disease, signs and symptoms / Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Antibodies tested list all antibodies that were tested, separated by semicolons

antibody_notes.description: Section: 4. section: established disease, signs and symptoms / Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Antibody notes If not covered by columns to the left, give as text note. Otherwise, leave blank.

CSF_status.description: Section: 4. section: established disease, signs and symptoms / Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: CSF (select) - normal - inflammatory - isolated protein elevation - not_done = no CSF analysis performed - antibody_present = antibody present in CSF (specify Ab and titre in next cols) - NA = not available

CMUA.description: Section: 5. section: investigations (antibodies, electrophysiology, other) / Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: continuous motor unit activity (CMUA) 0 = not detected 1 = present NA = no EMG / unknown

exteroceptive_refl.description: Section: 5. section: investigations (antibodies, electrophysiology, other) / Disease Characteristics | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: enhanced exteroceptive reflexes 0 = not detected 1 = present NA = not done / unknown

brainstem_refl.description: Section: 5. section: investigations (antibodies, electrophysiology, other) / Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: brainstem reflexes 0 = not detected 1 = present NA = not done / unknown

MRI_normal.description: Section: 5. section: investigations (antibodies, electrophysiology, other) / Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: MRI 0 = normal 1 = abnormal (specify in next col) NA = no MRI performed, not reported, unclear

MRI_abnormalities.description: Section: 5. section: investigations (antibodies, electrophysiology, other) / Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: MRI abnormalities (text)

tu_screening.description: Section: 5. section: investigations (antibodies, electrophysiology, other) / Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Tumour screening 0 = normal / no tumour detected 1 = abnormal (specify in next col) NA = not performed

tu_screening_abnormal.description: Section: 5. section: investigations (antibodies, electrophysiology, other) / Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Tumour screening abnormal specify tumour entity with text

family_history.description: Section: 8.section: comments / Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Family history (select) - none = no fhx for SPSD or autoimmunity - autoimmune = fhx for autoimmunity (specify in next col) - SPSD = fhx for SPSD (specify in next col) - NA = unknown, not reported

family_history_abnormal.description: Section: 8.section: comments / Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Family history (text) if autoimmune diseases and/or SPSD are present, specify with text

autoimmunity.description: Section: 7. section: concomittant disease and family history / Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Concomitant autoimmunity (select) - none - thyroid = thyroid disease/thyroid antibodies - diabetes - vitiligo - gastric = pernicious anaemia/parietal cell antibodies - other= other, specify in next col

autoimmunity_specify.description: Section: 7. section: concomittant disease and family history / Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Concomitant autoimmunity (specify with text)

immunotherapy.description: Section: 5. section: investigations (antibodies, electrophysiology, other) / Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Immunotherapy (specify) - none = not done - steroids - IVIG - PLEX - RXB = Rituximab - CP = Cyclophopsphamide - Aza = Azathioprine - multiple = specify in next col - other = specify in next col - NA = unknown (multiple variants)

immunotherapy_multiple.description: Section: Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: If more than one type of treatment, report here from previous column

immunotherapy_other.description: Section: Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: If other treatment, report here from previous column

immunotherapy_detail.description: Section: Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Immunotherapy in detail (text) report the immunotherapy protocol in detail

immunotherapy_effect.description: Section: 6. section: treatment / Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Effect of immunotherapy (select) - none - worsening - improvement - stabilisation - NA = not known

sympt_treatment.description: Section: 6. section: treatment / Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Symptomatic treatment (select) - none - clonazepam - benzo = other benzodiazepines - baclofen - gabapentin - pregabalin - tizanidine - valproate - other (specify)

sympt_treatment_multiple.description: Section: Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: If more than one type of symptomatic treatment, report here from previous column, separate with semicolons

sympt_treatment_other.description: Section: Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: If other symptomatic treatment, report here from previous column

sympt_treatment_detail.description: Section: 6. section: treatment / Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Symptomatic treatment in detail (text) please describe way of administration and dose (multiple variants)

sympt_treatment_effect.description: Section: 6. section: treatment / Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Effect of symptomatic treatment (select) - none - improvement - NA = not known, NA (multiple variants)

other_treatment.description: Section: 7. section: concomittant disease and family history / Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form, Data Extraction | Guidance: Other treatment (text) (e.g. tumour therapy)

different_treatment.description: Section: Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: If treatment description does not fit the previous columns, specify the treatment as text and use the next columns to provide details.

different_treatment_duration.description: Section: Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Different treatment: duration (days)

different_treatment_response.description: Section: Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Different treatment: response (text)

different_treatment_extra.description: Section: Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Results of treatment, if more than one type of response and differential responses to types of treatments

adverse_events.description: Section: Investigations and Tests | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Adverse events (text) Copy paste the definition(s) of adverse events if one is provided by the authors.

sampling.description: Section: Sampling and Analysis | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Sampling (text) Copy from methods how recruitment was performed, such as single site or multicentric, consecutive patients, clinic, community, and other details.

sample_size_calc.description: Section: Sampling and Analysis | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Sample size calculation, study power (text) Does the study provide a sample size calculation, power, and other additional information about sampling and analysis? Copy and pasted if available.

stat_methods.description: Section: Sampling and Analysis | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Analysis (text) Statistical tests used to find the results - Copy and pasted if available.

limitations.description: Section: Additional Relevant Information | Applies to publication types: Data Extraction | Guidance: Use this column to make comments related to study limitations

onset_mRS.description: Section: 3. section: disease onset, signs and symptoms | Applies to publication types: Case Report Form | Guidance: Disability at onset - SPSD symptoms established; mRS 0 - No symptoms. 1 - No significant disability. Able to carry out all usual activities, despite some symptoms. 2 - Slight disability. Able to look after own affairs without assistance, but unable to carry out all previous activities. 3 - Moderate disability. Requires some help, but able to walk unassisted (i.e., without another person). 4 - Moderately severe disability. Unable to attend to own bodily needs without assistance, and unable to walk unassisted. 5 - Severe disability. Requires constant nursing care and attention, bedridden, incontinent. 6 - Dead
